    • isVisible

      public boolean isVisible()
      Returns true if this element is visible. Please note that this is with regards to that element only. It's possible that this element is invisible (because of any of its parent elements is invisible) and still this method will return true;
      Returns:
      if this element is visible returns true. when the element is invisible returns false.

    • isVisibleWithParent

      public boolean isVisibleWithParent()
      Returns true if this element is visible and all of its parent hierarchy is visible too.
      Returns:
      if this element is really visible and false if it is invisible.

    • buildMouseOverElements

      public void buildMouseOverElements(@Nonnull NiftyMouseInputEvent mouseEvent, long eventTime, @Nonnull MouseOverHandler mouseOverHandler)
      This should check if the mouse event is inside the current element and if it is forward the event to it's child. The purpose of this is to build a list of all elements from front to back that are available for a certain mouse position.

    • mouseEventHoverPreprocess

      public void mouseEventHoverPreprocess(@Nonnull NiftyMouseInputEvent mouseEvent, long eventTime)

    • mouseEvent

      public boolean mouseEvent(@Nonnull NiftyMouseInputEvent mouseEvent, long eventTime)
      Process mouse event for this element
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent -
      eventTime - is the current time in milliseconds
      Returns:
      True if the event has been processed

    • mouseOverEvent

      public boolean mouseOverEvent(@Nonnull NiftyMouseInputEvent mouseEvent, long eventTime)
      Handles the MouseOverEvent. Must not call child elements. This is handled by the caller.
      Returns:
      true the mouse event has been consumed and false when the mouse event can be processed further down

    • isMouseInsideElement

      public boolean isMouseInsideElement(int mouseX, int mouseY)

    • onClick

      @Deprecated public void onClick()
      Deprecated.
      Use onClickAndReleasePrimaryMouseButton() instead. Simulates a click-release of the primary mouse button on the element.
      See Also:
      • onClickAndReleasePrimaryMouseButton()
      • onClickAndReleaseSecondaryMouseButton()
      • onClickAndReleaseSecondaryMouseButton()

    • onClickAndReleasePrimaryMouseButton

      public void onClickAndReleasePrimaryMouseButton()
      Simulates a click-release of the primary mouse button on the element. This method is called automatically in many cases as a response to receiving a NiftyStandardInputEvent.Activate event. An element will not respond to a click-release of the primary mouse button in the following situations: 1) When the element is disabled. 2) When a Screen is starting or ending, or more specifically, when: EffectEventId.onStartScreen or EffectEventId.onEndScreen effects are active on the current Screen. 3) If there is no current Screen, i.e., the current Screen is null.
      See Also:
      • ElementInteraction.clickAndReleasePrimaryMouseButton(de.lessvoid.nifty.Nifty)
      • onClickAndReleaseSecondaryMouseButton()
      • onClickAndReleaseTertiaryMouseButton()
      • NiftyStandardInputEvent.Activate
      • isEnabled()
      • enable()
      • disable()
      • Screen.isEffectActive(de.lessvoid.nifty.effects.EffectEventId)
      • EffectEventId.onStartScreen
      • EffectEventId.onEndScreen
      • Nifty.getCurrentScreen()

    • onClickAndReleaseSecondaryMouseButton

      public void onClickAndReleaseSecondaryMouseButton()
      Simulates a click-release of the secondary mouse button on the element. An element will not respond to a click-release of the secondary mouse button in the following situations: 1) When the element is disabled. 2) When a Screen is starting or ending, or more specifically, when: EffectEventId.onStartScreen or EffectEventId.onEndScreen effects are active on the current Screen. 3) If there is no current Screen, i.e., the current Screen is null.
      See Also:
      • ElementInteraction.clickAndReleaseSecondaryMouseButton(de.lessvoid.nifty.Nifty)
      • onClickAndReleasePrimaryMouseButton()
      • onClickAndReleaseTertiaryMouseButton()
      • isEnabled()
      • enable()
      • disable()
      • Screen.isEffectActive(de.lessvoid.nifty.effects.EffectEventId)
      • EffectEventId.onStartScreen
      • EffectEventId.onEndScreen
      • Nifty.getCurrentScreen()

    • onClickAndReleaseTertiaryMouseButton

      public void onClickAndReleaseTertiaryMouseButton()
      Simulates a click-release of the tertiary mouse button on the element. An element will not respond to a click-release of the tertiary mouse button in the following situations: 1) When the element is disabled. 2) When a Screen is starting or ending, or more specifically, when: EffectEventId.onStartScreen or EffectEventId.onEndScreen effects are active on the current Screen. 3) If there is no current Screen, i.e., the current Screen is null.
      See Also:
      • ElementInteraction.clickAndReleaseTertiaryMouseButton(de.lessvoid.nifty.Nifty)
      • onClickAndReleasePrimaryMouseButton()
      • onClickAndReleaseSecondaryMouseButton()
      • isEnabled()
      • enable()
      • disable()
      • Screen.isEffectActive(de.lessvoid.nifty.effects.EffectEventId)
      • EffectEventId.onStartScreen
      • EffectEventId.onEndScreen
      • Nifty.getCurrentScreen()
